title: Legend of Zelda Ocarina of Time
description: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time, a 1998 action-adventure game by Nintendo for the Nintendo 64, was released in Japan and North America in November 1998 and in PAL regions the following month; it is the first game in the Legend of Zelda series with 3D graphics.

review.story: The story of Ocarina of Time follows a classic hero’s journey, filled with depth and heart, as Link starts as a young boy in a tranquil forest before embarking on a world-spanning adventure exploring themes of time, destiny, and growth; the game’s vast and richly detailed world of Hyrule, including lush forests, eerie temples, and vast fields, creates an atmosphere of wonder that makes every corner worth exploring.
review.gameplay: At its core, Ocarina of Time is an action-adventure game with puzzle-solving, exploration, and combat; the innovative Z-targeting system made combat smooth and intuitive, while the ocarina served as both a plot device and gameplay mechanic. The game’s time-based puzzles and the ability to travel between the past and future using the Song of Time were game-changing, pushing the boundaries of interactive storytelling. The dungeons are memorable and varied in design and challenges, offering unique experiences that require intelligence and patience, with boss fights often demanding players to learn patterns and use items creatively.
review.graphics: For its time, Ocarina of Time had impressive visuals that captured the essence of Zelda’s iconic style in 3D; while it may seem dated by modern standards, the game’s art direction still holds up and evokes nostalgia. The music, composed by Koji Kondo, is iconic, featuring memorable themes like the overworld theme, the ocarina songs, and the hauntingly beautiful Serenade of Water.
review.sound: For its time, Ocarina of Time had impressive visuals that captured Zelda’s iconic style in 3D; though dated by modern standards, its art direction still holds up and evokes nostalgia, while the music, composed by Koji Kondo, remains iconic with memorable themes like the overworld theme, ocarina songs, and the haunting Serenade of Water.

title: Shadow Warrior
description: Shadow Warrior is a series of first-person shooter video games that focuses on the exploits of Lo Wang, a modern ninja warrior who fights through hordes of demons.

review.story: The story of Shadow Warrior centers around the character Lo Wang, a wisecracking, skilled assassin who works for a powerful Japanese corporation. The plot kicks off when Lo Wang is tasked with retrieving a mystical sword, the Nobitsura Kage, which becomes a central piece of the game’s conflict. The narrative blends action with humor, offering a mixture of ancient mythology, samurai lore, and over-the-top action. While the plot isn't groundbreaking, it serves as an entertaining backdrop for the action-packed gameplay and Lo Wang's hilarious, often crude quips.
review.gameplay: Shadow Warrior is a fast-paced, first-person shooter that combines traditional gunplay with close-quarters combat using a katana. The game’s combat is fluid and satisfying, with players switching between various weapons and swordplay. The sword fights, in particular, are a standout feature, offering a seamless and enjoyable blend of hacking and slashing against a variety of enemies. The level design is diverse, ranging from traditional Japanese settings to more futuristic environments. While it may be straightforward at times, the fun of the game lies in the fluid combat and the constant action. The progression system allows Lo Wang to upgrade his weapons and abilities, further enhancing the excitement.
review.graphics: The graphics in Shadow Warrior are impressive for a 2013 release. The environments are richly detailed, with beautiful vistas, traditional Japanese architecture, and grotesque enemy designs. The game’s visual style does a great job of blending traditional Eastern aesthetics with modern, high-tech elements. The lighting and textures are well-executed, especially when exploring ancient shrines or battling enemies in dark, atmospheric settings. While not the most photorealistic game, Shadow Warrior maintains a strong visual identity that’s fitting for its action-packed tone.
review.sound: The sound design in Shadow Warrior is excellent, enhancing the immersion and action. The soundtrack complements the game’s intense combat sequences with energetic and dramatic music, often inspired by Eastern themes. Weapon sounds, particularly the katana's slashing and gunshots, are satisfying and punchy. Voice acting is another highlight, with Lo Wang’s sarcastic, often crude humor delivered by a strong performance. His banter adds an extra layer of personality to the game. The sound effects overall do a great job of keeping the player engaged in the fast-paced action.
